channel.title: Mask technology
channel.description: Hello, Are there any actual technological means that could be used as masks for roleplaying games. I mean : in LARP, latex and false teeth have become very accessible. But on the internet or via phone, there's probably something like that ? - user avatars and bios - still image effects (like John Harper's silhouettes) - video effects - voice masks - steganographic txt filter ?

item.title: Mask technology
item.dc:creator: @Alun_R
item.description:
@Alun_R wrote:

I’ve toyed with the technology that created ‘Lawyer Cat’, but not certain whether I could live with it for a full session … but worth looking at Snap Camera in Zoom.

Read full topic

item.title: Mask technology
item.dc:creator: @DeReel
item.description:
@DeReel wrote:

Hello,
Are there any actual technological means that could be used as masks for roleplaying games.
I mean : in LARP, latex and false teeth have become very accessible. But on the internet or via phone, there’s probably something like that ?

  • user avatars and bios
  • still image effects (like John Harper’s silhouettes)
  • video effects
  • voice masks
  • steganographic txt filter ?

Read full topic
